Paragraph: Mean ALT and AST levels were 124 . 4 + / - 73 . 4 and 103 . 1 + / - 81 IU / l , respectively .

Let's think step by step.

| --- |

These entities are clearly diseases or conditions that can be indicated by increased levels of ALT and AST in the blood.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Mean ALT and AST levels were 124 . 4 + / - 73 . 4 and 103 . 1 + / - 81 IU / l , respectively .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| ALT (Alanine Aminotransferase) |
| AST (Aspartate Aminotransferase) |
| IU/l (International Units per Liter) |

Explanation:
The paragraph mentions "Mean ALT and AST levels". ALT and AST are enzymes, specifically Alanine Aminotransferase and Aspartate Aminotransferase, respectively. The units of measurement for these enzymes are given as "IU/l" which stands for "International Units per Liter".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| ALT (Alanine Aminotransferase) |
| AST (Aspartate Aminotransferase) |
| IU/l (International Units per Liter) |

Explanation:
The paragraph mentions "Mean ALT and AST levels" which clearly refers to the chemical entities Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) and Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST). The units of measurement for these enzymes are given as "IU/l" which stands for "International Units per Liter" and is also a chemical entity in this context as it is a unit of measurement. Therefore, all three entities are valid and should be included in the table.
